721359f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side looking north from 50th Street. On east side between 5Oth and 5lst Street is the double house built by the late Whitelaw Reid. On N.E. corner of 5lst Street is the former residence of Mrs. Oliver H.P. Belmont, built about 1899. Next to the north is new Columbia Broadcasting building, on S.E.
corner of 52nd Street.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

721365f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, east side, from East 50th to 51st Street. This view shows the 51st Street side of the R. C. Cathedral of St. Patrick prior to the addition of the twin steeples (1888). The Archbishopric is on the left and fronts on Madison Avenue. This was proposed for a Fifth Avenue frontage by Archbishop Hughes. The property decided upon was through picue purchased by an infamous abortionist,"Madame Restell".
1888
Through the New York Historical Society
